file_content.text: I'm staying put. There's a lot more I need to see if we're going to get these HK units out.
Here's your cargo manifest. The Fatality was carrying HK droids.
HK droids haven't been seen in the galaxy for decades.
What exactly is an HK droid? What are they used for?
Explain these HKs.
Better head for the Fatality now. It isn't getting any warmer.
Finally! I've been comming the Republic for days. Starting to get frostbite out here.
They can kill each other for all I care. I want to know what's in that wreck that's worth fighting for.
Trust me-- whatever's down there, it's big.
Always nice to see a warm, friendly face. Well, a friendly one, anyway.
I have everything we need to reactivate the HK droids.
Everything except the best droid engineer in the sector. Luckily, he owes me a favor. He'll meet you inside the Fatality when it's clear.
And yes, that means enemy forces have retaken the ship. This time, a Sith calling himself the Lord of Agony.
I fought more than a few Sith getting these parts. One more shouldn't make much difference.
He won't be a problem for me.
This one's not your average Sith. He tore through a platoon of our soldiers like they were flimsiplast.
Whom does this lord serve? The Dread Masters, the Empire, or himself?
Tell me who he works for.
Does it matter? He's between us and an army of assassin droids.
I guess it's too much to hope that he attacks people with boring conversation?
That doesn't sound good.
No, that's the Lord of Annoyance. Different guy.
Say what you want about Sith, but I appreciate their openness. You always know what their hobbies and interests are.
At least he's honest.
Personally, I'd prefer they keep more to themselves.
The Republic couldn't spare a platoon to secure the Fatality while I was gone?
How did this happen?
The Republic assigned a whole company to guard the crash site. It didn't make any difference.
He'll have to change his nickname to the Lord of Corpses when I'm done.
Don't worry, I'll kill him.
I think that name's taken. Wicked little guy on Nar Shaddaa. You don't want to know.
You're in for a nightmare of a fight, but it's the only way to keep those HK droids out of enemy hands.
Once the Fatality is safe to enter, my engineer friend will head inside. Not much of a talker, but he gets the job done.
...and that ship is filled with them. Some kind of secret Imperial project. No wonder our friends are fighting over that wreck.
That doesn't explain why the Fatality came to Belsavis years ago. Was the Empire planning to use those droids here?
There's more to this story.
Not the Empire--an apprentice of the Dread Masters. According to this, he stole the Fatality and its HKs at their command.
Skipped history class? The HK model was the deadliest assassin droid ever produced. The most famous one was made to order for Darth Revan.
Let's demolish that ship and be rid of this threat once and for all.
We should destroy the droids.
Hang on, we're talking about serious hardware--the kind that wins wars for whoever controls it.
It's all starting to make sense. The Dread Masters used their powers to guide the Fatality and its HKs here to stage a breakout.
That plan failed, but now our enemies can use the droids for something much worse.
What's the damage potential of these droids? How much could they do to us?
The droids are that powerful?
A single HK droid operating alone can easily eliminate military, political and economic leaders. The Fatality holds dozens of HKs. An army.
The Houk and his minions are all dead. The Dread Masters aren't a problem.
But we defeated their forces.
They're not our only enemies. What if the Empire gets these things--or the Hutt Cartel?
There wasn't a single HK droid on the ship that wasn't damaged and frozen in ice.
The HKs I saw were broken.
You can bet our enemies have a plan to fix them.
HK droids are a bigger advantage than our enemies deserve. We've got to get those things out of the Fatality and working for us.
How can we use something designed for evil to do anything good?
I'm not sure I agree.
Assassination isn't the Republic's style--but if we take out enough Sith to end this war we'll be saving billions of lives.
I could do a lot of good with an assassin droid on my team.
What about working for me?
Considering how many defeats you've personally handed the Empire, I'd say you're exactly who needs an HK unit.
I've heard assassin droids have a tendency to kill their own masters.
HKs shouldn't be trusted.
Only the ones with poor programming. Remember, they're just machines.
Problem is, the Fatality's droids were all damaged in the crash. They've spent years on ice, but we need them working yesterday.
Schematics and spare parts are the key ingredients. I know for a fact Czerka Corporation maintains HK designs in their laboratory databases.
If it's the only way to ensure the HKs don't wind up in enemy hands, I'll do whatever it takes.
Then let's get them.
You've got a track record for achieving the impossible, master Jedi. I like that.
I doubt Czerka's leaders will just hand over the schematics. That doesn't leave us too many legal options.
We need a plan.
We don't need Czerka's permission. They desert their operations without wiping the databanks all the time.
I'll start by asking Czerka nicely. If that doesn't work, I know lots of other ways to ask.
I can get whatever we need.
I think we can do this without going to war with an entire corporation.
Good old Czerka... you can always count on those guys to have things they shouldn't. Time for a little breaking and entering.
Sounds like a plan.
Probably more of the former than the latter.
The Republic has no business reactivating murderous droids designed by the Empire. This will end badly.
I want no part of this.
Unlike people, droids can be reprogrammed. If anything goes wrong, we'll pull the plug.
You're the spy. Go fetch those things yourself.
Great. Go and get them.
In case it's not obvious, I'm the kind of spy who's good at watching and not much else.
I have a lead on one private Czerka complex. Raiding it won't be easy, but what is? The rest will be up to you.
Get the schematics and whatever parts we'll need. I'll maintain position and watch the Fatality until you get back. Be seeing you.
Name's Bren. I'm SIS. Been tracking intel reports of Imperial activity in Belsavis's frigid zone. Nothing's supposed to be here.
Turns out there's something: the "Fatality." Imperial destroyer downed years ago. The Dread Masters' forces are holding it like she's still spaceworthy.
The Empire didn't know Belsavis existed until recently. Are you saying one of their warships came here that long ago?
That ship shouldn't be here.
Republic brass locked down the incident tighter than a Sith Lord's helmet, but yeah--that recent invasion wasn't the first.
So the Imperials aren't the only ones after this wreck. That ship must really be something.
Dread Master forces, too?
Don't get me wrong, the Fatality's a write-off--which makes this all the more interesting.
Once the Imperials and the Dread Masters have softened each other up, we can carpet bomb the lot of them.
Good. Let them fight.
Been piecing together old intel reports. Long time back, shortly after the Dread Masters' capture, the Fatality paid Belsavis a surprise visit.
We shot it down before it could do much damage. Looked like the vessel disintegrated on impact. No more Imp ships came, so we figured it was a fluke.
Hard to believe an Imperial destroyer accidentally stumbled onto the Republic's top-secret prison.
It was no coincidence.
That's how it looked then... but the Dread Masters knew to look for the Fatality's wreckage. I'm thinking it came here to rescue them.
No escape pods launched before the Fatality went down? It must have been a short fight.
Did anyone survive?
We got lucky--cracked the enemy's reactor with our first hit. Crew died from radiation exposure. Better than freezing under the ice, I guess.
If there's more to that wreck than scrap metal, whoever shot down the Fatality didn't do his job.
Our people failed.
We scanned the Fatality's crash site and found nothing. Now I know why--the Imp vessel went deep under the ice.
I got close to the fighting out there. The Dread Masters' forces are a nasty bunch, led by a mean mountain of a Houk.
The Imps are terrified of this guy. Heard the commander telling his men the Houk's hunting them for sport. Can't argue with that assessment.
Imperial soldiers don't scare easily. The leader of the Dread Masters' forces must be especially dangerous.
Neither can I.
I've seen this Houk, master Jedi. "Dangerous" is an understatement.
I sense great evil at work here. The Dread Masters have sent something malignant to protect their objective.
I have a very bad feeling.
My guess? The Imperials bought us very little time to sort this out in our favor.
If your intel's right, the Dread Masters have the upper hand here.
Seems like the Houk's winning.
They've definitely got position. The Houk and his men are down in the wreck, and the Imps are outside licking their wounds.
What I'm hearing is, challenging the Houk to a game of sabacc probably isn't an option.
There goes my sly approach.
I don't think he plays cards. Might eat them, I suppose.
If either enemy force had caught you watching them, this conversation wouldn't be happening.
You're lucky to be alive.
That's the spy lifestyle. Glamorous as it sounds, I decided to fall back when I saw that Houk.
I've faced all kinds of predators, animal and otherwise. The Imperials may be easily frightened, but I'm not.
Is that supposed to scare me?
Fear's not the issue. This Dread Master legion is vicious and dug in deep.
Whatever's inside the Fatality, we don't want the Imps or Dread Masters getting it. People like you could make sure they don't.
I didn't listen to all this just to say "no." Of course I'll help you.
Count me in.
If they aren't fighting over some ancient secret weapon that could crack the galaxy in half, I'll be very disappointed.
This better be worth my time.
I'll make sure the Fatality earns it name. Dread Master forces... Imperial troops... they all die.
I'll kill them all.
I appreciate thoroughness, but don't lose sight of what these people are chasing. That's the prize.
I'm giving you coordinates to the Fatality's excavation site. Send the competition packing and hunt down the ship's cargo manifest. Then we'll know what we're dealing with. Be seeing you.
Thanks to you, maybe now we can get the rest of those HK droids working for the Republic.
There's a Czerka complex you can raid for the schematics. At least give it a look before making up your mind.
Regardless, I'm stuck here until the Republic sends reinforcements. Be seeing you--I hope.
